ok @ everyone who is struggling with the profile thing. I just got back from school and installed it myself so here's what to do its very simple my friends.

my specs: windows 7 ultimate 64bit
software: Alcohol 120%

1. Mount the ISO file in Alcohol 120%
2. Install Game, deselect desktop icon shortcut
3. Once game finishes installation, if a shortcut for the desktop is still made delete it.
4. Open My Computer, Click on BD-Rom Drive: Need for speed wanted
5. (You may need to add acceptions to your antivirus for this part) Open skidrow folder right click NFS file copy.
6. Go to installation directory, so Program Files(x86) > EA > NFS
7. Paste the file in there and REPLACE existing one.
8. Click start menu, in the search box type Firewall, SELECT FIREWALL WITH ADVANCED SECURITIES
9. On the Left hand side you should see "Outbound Rules" left click it then right click it, click NEW RULE
10. "What type of rule would you like to create?" PROGRAM, click next
11. Select "this program path" browse to the need for speed installation directory and select the NFS13 file that you copied over, click open, click next
12. Select BLOCK THE CONNECTION, click next
13. SELECT ALL BOXES, DOMAIN PRIVATE AND PUBLIC MAKE SURE THEY'RE ALL FILLED IN WITH A CHECKMARK, click next
14. Give the Rule a name i called it NFS (cuz i only have one NFS game installed), then click finish, close firewall window

15. go back to installation directory, go to the NFS13 file you copied over right click > send to > desktop (create shortcut, then place that shortcut wherever you like)

16. Run the shortcut file, when you reach the part where it says you need origin to access the online content, give it a middle finger and press A (i use 360 controller) or press Enter w.e option, you should then be lead right into the game Intro and the game will start after.


Have fun....please note that I JUST started the game so i dont know if i have the full game or not...but i've gotten past the origin account thing. 


Enjoy folks

For those having problems with getting the game running, its like oldschool cracks:
1 - Mount iso
2 - Open folder
3 - Double click setup and install
4 - Go into the folder in the iso called SKIDROW
5 - Copy NFS13.exe
6 - After install do NOT open game, paste NFS13.exe in installation folder (c:/program files/EA games/Most wanted) or something like that
7 - COPY AND REPLACE
8 - enjoy

This game is fucking trash. The graphics aren't that great and the frames dip horribly. I tried locking my frames to 30 in the config file which helped a little bit, but is in fact still shit. This game wasn't very good at all, or at least the PC version anyway. I expected most of the negative comments to be typical internet hate but the game just wasn't worth the time. It's hard to complain about something you got 1000% free that normally costs $60 but this game was a shoddy port. It has a lot of framerate dips, from what I've read it has v-sync on constantly and you can't disable it. You just know the controls are bad when a modern PC game by default uses the arrow keys instead of WSAD. After remapping the controls, I discovered that the steering is way too sensitive like a tap left or right sends you off like a bat out of hell. They really didn't put much effort into the PC version.

In reference to karthikhe, burning refers to copying the game files over onto a CD, whereas mounting refers to using a virtual drive program such as Daemon Tools Lite (Google it, very good program) to make the game think it's on a CD.

It makes it much easier to manage these things overall and I suggest getting Daemon Tools as they don't have a size limit.

@karthikhe

You need to download Daemon Tools or PowerISO if you do not have those already.

Once those are installed you right-click on the .iso file, and go to the PowerISO sub menu and you click to mount to a virtual drive. If you have Daemon tools then you go to the bottom right of your desktop to the small icons, right-click on the deamon icon (silver circle with blue lightning bolt) and you click to mount to a drive, you browse to the file then click.

Now the iso should appear on "My Computer" as if you inserted an actual CD. This is for Windows because thats what i run on:P
